newsitem.title: USA: Millennium gets $300 mln real estate financing.
newsitem.headline: Millennium gets $300 mln real estate financing.

text.p: Millennium Partners, a New York City-based real estate development firm, said Monday that it had obtained $300 million in financing from Goldman Sachs & Co's Whitehall Fund, the Quantum Realty Ltd Fund of financier George Soros, Soros family interests, and a consortium of German financial institutions.
Millennium said the money will enable it to complete the more than $1 billion worth of real estate projects now in predevelopment.

Millennium Partners specializes in large mixed-use urban developments. In is currently building a 1.7 million square foot $500 million project in Manhattan and and recently broke ground for a similar project in San Francisco. The company said sites in Washington, D.C., Boston, and suburban San Francisco are either under control or have been identified for major mixed-use projects anchored by an entertainment or fitness presence, and that it is scouting sites in Toronto, Miami, and Chicago.
Millennium, Goldman Sachs, the Soros Fund and the lead German company, the insurer Victoria Versicherungs -Gesellschaften, are all privately-held.
